objectives: Students will discuss family and relationships using Slang/Street register language
Students will engage with Historical themed scenarios related to family and relationships
Students will demonstrate appropriate use of slang level vocabulary and expressions
Students will create dialogues combining family and relationships content with Historical narrative elements

warm_up.description: Students explore family and relationships through a Historical lens using Slang/Street language
warm_up.scenario: Imagine a historical period or event involving family and relationships

main_activities.description: Students learn and practice slang register vocabulary related to family and relationships in a historical context
Students engage in historical themed role-play about family and relationships using slang register
Students create original historical themed content about family and relationships in slang register

discussion_questions: How would you describe family and relationships in a Historical scenario?
What tradition or heritage might be involved in family and relationships?
Can you create a Historical story about family and relationships?
How does family and relationships change when viewed through a Historical perspective?
What slang register expressions would you use to discuss this historical scenario?

role_play_scenarios.scenario: Historical situation involving family and relationships
roles: Character A: Using slang register in historical context
Character B: Responding in slang register within historical theme

teacher_transformation_guide.register_guidance: Use Slang/Street throughout: Casual street language, colloquialisms, youth speak
teacher_transformation_guide.genre_guidance: Frame all content with Historical theme: Past eras, historical events, period settings

assessment.register_focus: Students demonstrate mastery of Slang/Street register
assessment.genre_focus: Students engage with Historical themed content
criteria: Appropriate use of slang register language
Comprehension of topic within new context

methodology: Augmented CLT with Register & Genre Transformation
